definition: to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: Sharing a bed with a partner who tosses and turns or kicks or snores can give you just as much trouble falling asleep.
sentences.chinese: 如果伴侶睡覺總是翻來動去或打呼嚕，那也真夠鬧心。

sentences.english: Liking a person is very heart wrenching.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡一個人可真是鬧心啊。

sentences.english: Tied to a corner of the cellar, such as the ants when Mr Zhang is flustered.
sentences.chinese: 被綁在地窖一角如百蟻鬧心的張志強氣急敗壞。

sentences.english: And why does it bother you so much?
sentences.chinese: 而這又爲什麼讓你如此鬧心？

sentences.english: And people wonder why the fans are so upset.
sentences.chinese: 還有人奇怪爲什麼粉絲們這麼鬧心嗎。

sentences.english: But when the vision remained blurred for several days, my mind began to wander.
sentences.chinese: 但是，過了好幾天，視力仍然模糊，我開始鬧心。
